```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(heemod)
library(dplyr)
```

Input transition probabilities from defined distributions:

```{r}
surv_dist1 <- define_survival(
  distribution = "weibull",
  shape = 2,
  scale = 5
)
```

From fitted models:

```{r fig.width=6, fig.height=6}
library(flexsurv)

fitw <- flexsurvreg(
  formula = Surv(futime, fustat) ~ 1,
  data = ovarian, dist = "weibull"
)
plot(fitw)

km <- survfit(
  formula = Surv(futime, fustat) ~ 1,
  data = ovarian
)
```

For the example we define a simple model with only 1 strategy:

```{r warning=FALSE}
param <- define_parameters(
  p1 = eval_surv(
    surv_dist1,
    cycle = markov_cycle # can also be state_cycle
  ),
  p2 = km %>%
    project(fitw, at = 730) %>%
    eval_surv(markov_cycle, cycle_length = 365) # time is in days in fitw, in years in markov_cycle
)

tm <- define_transition(
  C, p1, 0,
  0, C,  p2,
  0, 0,  C
)

plot(tm)

sA <-  define_state(
  cost = 10, ut = 1
)
sB <-  define_state(
  cost = 20, ut = .5
)
sC <-  define_state(
  cost = 0, ut = 0
)

stratTM <- define_strategy(
  transition = tm,
  A = sA, B = sB, C = sC
)

resTM <- run_model(
  parameters = param,
  stratTM,
  cycles = 10
)
```

```{r fig.width=6}
plot(resTM)
```

A partitioned survival model can also be computed:

```{r warning=FALSE}
surv_dist2 <- define_survival(
  distribution = "exp",
  rate = .5
)

ps <- define_part_surv(
  pfs = surv_dist2,
  os = fitw,
  cycle_length = c(1, 365) # 1 for pfs, 365 for os
)

stratPS <- define_strategy(
  transition = ps,
  A = sA, B = sB, C = sC
)

resPS <- run_model(
  stratPS,
  cycles = 10
)
```

```{r fig.width=6}
plot(resPS)
```
